name: Corn
description: Corn is a tall cereal plant that produces large grains on ears.
variety_info: Includes sweet corn, field corn, and popcorn varieties.

name: Tomato
description: Tomatoes are juicy, red fruits commonly used in cooking.
variety_info: Includes cherry, beefsteak, and heirloom varieties.

name: Potato
description: Potatoes are starchy tubers that are a staple food in many cultures.
variety_info: Includes russet, red, and yellow potatoes.

name: Bell Pepper
description: Bell peppers are sweet, bell-shaped fruits that come in various colors.
variety_info: Includes green, red, yellow, and orange varieties.

name: Chili Pepper
description: Chili peppers are hot fruits used to add spice to dishes.
variety_info: Includes jalapeño, habanero, and cayenne varieties.

name: Pumpkin
description: Pumpkins are large, orange fruits often used for decoration.
variety_info: Includes pie pumpkins and carving pumpkins.

name: Butternut Squash
description: Butternut squash is a sweet, nutty-flavored winter squash.
variety_info: Includes early and late varieties.

name: Acorn Squash
description: Acorn squash is a small, acorn-shaped winter squash.
variety_info: Includes green and golden varieties.

name: Zucchini
description: Zucchini is a summer squash that is harvested when immature.
variety_info: Includes green and yellow varieties.

name: Lettuce
description: Lettuce is a leafy vegetable commonly used in salads.
variety_info: Includes romaine, iceberg, and butterhead varieties.

name: Spinach
description: Spinach is a leafy green vegetable rich in iron and vitamins.
variety_info: Common varieties include Bloomsdale and Savoy.

name: Kale
description: Kale is a nutrient-dense leafy green that is very popular for salads and smoothies.
variety_info: Popular varieties include Curly Kale and Lacinato.

name: Broccoli
description: Broccoli is a cruciferous vegetable known for its dense flower heads.
variety_info: Common varieties include Calabrese and Purple Sprouting.

name: Cauliflower
description: Cauliflower is a cruciferous vegetable with a compact flower head.
variety_info: Popular varieties include Snowball and Purple Cauliflower.

name: Carrot
description: Carrots are root vegetables known for their sweet flavor and vibrant color.
variety_info: Common varieties include Nantes and Imperator.

name: Onion
description: Onions are bulbous vegetables with a strong flavor used in various cuisines.
variety_info: Common varieties include Yellow, Red, and Sweet onions.

name: Garlic
description: Garlic is a flavorful bulb used as a seasoning and for medicinal purposes.
variety_info: Common varieties include Softneck and Hardneck.

name: Sweet Potato
description: Sweet potatoes are starchy root vegetables known for their sweet flavor.
variety_info: Common varieties include Beauregard and Jewel.

name: Cucumber
description: Cucumbers are refreshing fruits often used in salads and pickles.
variety_info: Common varieties include Slicing and Pickling cucumbers.

name: Green Beans
description: Green beans are tender, edible pods that can be eaten fresh or cooked.
variety_info: Common varieties include Bush beans and Pole beans.

name: Peas
description: Peas are sweet, edible seeds that come in pods and are often used in a variety of dishes.
variety_info: Varieties include Sugar Snap, Snow Peas, and Green Peas.

name: Radish
description: Radishes are quick-growing root vegetables that come in various shapes and colors.
variety_info: Includes Cherry Belle, French Breakfast, and Daikon.

name: Beetroot
description: Beetroots are root vegetables known for their deep red color and earthy flavor.
variety_info: Varieties include Detroit Dark Red, Chioggia, and Golden Beet.

name: Eggplant
description: Eggplants are glossy, purple fruits that are commonly used in Mediterranean cuisine.
variety_info: Varieties include Black Beauty, Italian, and Japanese.

name: Celery
description: Celery is a crunchy, nutritious vegetable often used in salads and soups.
variety_info: Varieties include Tall Utah, Golden Self-Blanching, and Pascal.

name: Okra
description: Okra is a tall, flowering plant known for its edible green seed pods.
variety_info: Includes Clemson Spineless, Burgundy, and Ladyfinger.

name: Turnip
description: Turnips are root vegetables with a slightly peppery flavor, often used in soups and stews.
variety_info: Includes Hakurei, Purple Top, and Golden Ball.

name: Cabbage
description: Cabbage is a leafy green vegetable that is often used in salads, soups, and sauerkraut.
variety_info: Includes Green, Red, and Savoy cabbage.

name: Apple
description: Apples are a popular fruit, known for their crisp texture and sweet-tart flavor.
variety_info: Varieties include Fuji, Gala, and Granny Smith.

name: Crabapple
description: Crabapples are small, tart apples often used for ornamental purposes and jelly.
variety_info: Includes Dolgo, Whitney, and Snowdrift.

name: Pear
description: A deciduous tree known for its sweet, juicy fruit.
variety_info: Includes varieties like Bartlett, Bosc, and Anjou.

name: Peach
description: A popular fruit tree known for its sweet and juicy peaches.
variety_info: Includes varieties like Clingstone, Freestone, and Donut.

name: Plum
description: A deciduous tree that produces sweet and tart plums.
variety_info: Includes varieties like Santa Rosa and Satsuma.

name: Apricot
description: A small tree that produces sweet, orange fruits.
variety_info: Includes varieties like Tilton and Moorpark.

name: Cherry
description: A tree that produces small, round, and sweet or tart cherries.
variety_info: Includes varieties like Bing and Rainier.

name: Blueberry
description: A bush that produces small, round, sweet berries.
variety_info: Includes varieties like Highbush, Lowbush, and Rabbiteye.

name: Cranberry
description: A low-growing shrub that produces tart red berries.
variety_info: Includes varieties like Early Blacks and Ben Lear.

name: Blackberry
description: A thorny shrub that produces sweet, dark berries.
variety_info: Includes varieties like Marionberry and Boysenberry.

name: Raspberry
description: A bramble that produces sweet, red or black berries.
variety_info: Includes varieties like Red, Black, and Yellow.

name: Strawberry
description: A low-growing plant that produces sweet, red berries.
variety_info: Includes varieties like June-bearing and Ever-bearing.

name: Grape
description: Grapes are small, round fruits that grow in clusters. They can be eaten fresh or used to make wine.
variety_info: Common varieties include Concord, Thompson Seedless, and Red Globe.

name: Watermelon
description: Watermelons are large, sweet fruits with a high water content, perfect for hot summer days.
variety_info: Includes varieties like Sugar Baby, Crimson Sweet, and Seedless.

name: Cantaloupe
description: Cantaloupe is a sweet, orange-fleshed melon, often enjoyed fresh or in fruit salads.
variety_info: Popular varieties include Hales Best and Galia.

name: Avocado
description: Avocado is a creamy-textured fruit rich in healthy fats, often used in salads and spreads.
variety_info: Common varieties include Hass, Bacon, and Fuerte.

name: Orange
description: Oranges are juicy citrus fruits known for their sweet-tart flavor and high vitamin C content.
variety_info: Popular varieties include Valencia and Navel.

name: Lemon
description: Lemons are tart citrus fruits commonly used for flavoring, cooking, and beverages.
variety_info: Popular varieties include Eureka and Lisbon.

name: Lime
description: Limes are small, green citrus fruits known for their acidic flavor, used in drinks and cooking.
variety_info: Common varieties include Persian and Key Lime.

name: Papaya
description: Papaya is a tropical fruit known for its sweet taste and vibrant orange flesh.
variety_info: Popular varieties include Solo and Hawaiian.

name: Pineapple
description: Pineapple is a tropical fruit with a sweet-tart flavor and a unique spiky appearance.
variety_info: Includes varieties like Smooth Cayenne and Queen.

name: American Persimmon
description: The American Persimmon is a sweet, orange fruit that is often used in pies and preserves.
variety_info: Common varieties include Fuyu and Hachiya.

name: Pawpaw
description: Pawpaw is a small tree that produces large, edible fruit with a custard-like texture.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Mango', 'Sunflower', and 'Shenandoah'.

name: Elderberry
description: Elderberry is a deciduous shrub known for its clusters of small white flowers and dark berries.
variety_info: Popular varieties include 'Black Lace' and 'York'.

name: Mulberry
description: Mulberry trees produce sweet, edible fruits and have a broad canopy.
variety_info: Notable varieties include 'Illinois Everbearing' and 'Black Beauty'.

name: Gooseberry
description: Gooseberries are tart berries that grow on thorny bushes.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Invicta' and 'Hinnomaki Red'.

name: Basil
description: Basil is a fragrant herb commonly used in cooking, especially in Italian cuisine.
variety_info: Popular varieties include 'Genovese', 'Sweet Basil', and 'Thai Basil'.

name: Mint
description: Mint is a vigorous herb known for its refreshing aroma and flavor.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Peppermint' and 'Spearmint'.

name: Oregano
description: Oregano is a perennial herb popular in Mediterranean cuisine known for its aromatic leaves.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Greek Oregano' and 'Italian Oregano'.

name: Thyme
description: Thyme is a low-growing herb with a strong flavor, often used in cooking and as a medicinal herb.
variety_info: Popular varieties include 'English Thyme' and 'Lemon Thyme'.

name: Rosemary
description: Rosemary is an aromatic evergreen shrub often used in cooking and for ornamental purposes.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Tuscan Blue' and 'Arp'.

name: Sage
description: Sage is a savory herb commonly used in cooking and known for its distinct aroma.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Common Sage' and 'Purple Sage'.

name: Cilantro
description: Cilantro is a popular herb known for its fresh, citrusy flavor, commonly used in various cuisines.
variety_info: Common variety includes 'Cilantro Santo'.

name: Parsley
description: Parsley is a versatile herb, widely used as a garnish and in cooking for its flavor.
variety_info: Popular varieties include 'Giant of Italy' and 'Curly Leaf'.

name: Dill
description: Dill is an aromatic herb known for its feathery leaves and distinctive flavor, often used in pickling.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Bouquet' and 'Fernleaf'.

name: Chives
description: Chives are a mild onion-flavored herb, commonly used as a garnish and in salads.
variety_info: Varieties include 'Common Chives' and 'Garlic Chives'.

name: Tarragon
description: Tarragon is a perennial herb known for its distinct anise-like flavor, commonly used in French cuisine.
variety_info: French tarragon is the most commonly used variety.

name: Marjoram
description: Marjoram is a sweet, aromatic herb that adds flavor to various dishes, especially in Mediterranean cuisine.
variety_info: Common variety is 'Sweet Marjoram'.

name: Catnip
description: Catnip is a perennial herb known for its euphoric effects on cats and its culinary uses for humans.
variety_info: Common variety is 'Common Catnip'.

name: Wild Bergamot
description: Wild Bergamot is a perennial herb with aromatic leaves and flowers, attracting pollinators.
variety_info: Varieties include 'Monarda fistulosa'.

name: Yarrow
description: Yarrow is a hardy perennial herb known for its feathery leaves and medicinal properties.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Achillea millefolium'.

name: Sunflower
description: Sunflowers are tall, bright flowers that follow the sun, known for their seeds and oil production.
variety_info: Popular varieties include 'Giant Sunflower' and 'Teddy Bear'.

name: Black-Eyed Susan
description: A bright and cheerful flower with yellow petals and a dark brown center.
variety_info: Rudbeckia hirta

name: Coneflower
description: Sturdy flowers that attract pollinators with their vibrant purple petals.
variety_info: Echinacea purpurea

name: Goldenrod
description: A late summer bloom with bright yellow flowers that attract butterflies.
variety_info: Solidago canadensis

name: Aster
description: A beautiful flower that blooms in late summer and fall, providing vibrant colors.
variety_info: Aster spp.

name: Columbine
description: A delicate flower with unique, spurred petals that bloom in spring.
variety_info: Aquilegia caerulea

name: Lupine
description: Known for its tall spikes of colorful flowers, lupines are a favorite in gardens.
variety_info: Lupinus polyphyllus

name: Milkweed
description: Essential for monarch butterflies, milkweed produces large clusters of pink flowers.
variety_info: Asclepias tuberosa

name: Marigold
description: Bright, cheerful flowers that are easy to grow and repel certain pests.
variety_info: Tagetes erecta

name: Daisy
description: A classic flower with white petals and a yellow center, symbolizing purity.
variety_info: Bellis perennis

name: Wild Rose
description: A hardy shrub with fragrant pink flowers that bloom in spring and summer.
variety_info: Rosa spp.

name: Fireweed
description: A tall, herbaceous perennial plant known for its bright pink flowers and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
variety_info: Common variety includes Chamerion angustifolium.

name: Bluebell
description: A charming springtime flower with bell-shaped blooms that are typically blue, though they can also be pink or white.
variety_info: Hyacinthoides non-scripta is the most common variety.

name: Trillium
description: A woodland plant characterized by its three-petaled flowers and whorled leaves, often found in shady areas.
variety_info: Trillium grandiflorum is a popular variety.

name: Violet
description: Known for their heart-shaped leaves and delicate flowers, violets are often found in gardens and wild areas.
variety_info: Viola sororia is a common species.

name: Iris
description: Irises are known for their striking flowers and come in many colors, making them popular in ornamental gardens.
variety_info: Iris germanica is a common variety.

name: White Oak
description: A large, deciduous tree known for its beautiful foliage and strong wood, often found in forests and parks.
variety_info: Quercus alba is the scientific name.

name: Red Oak
description: A fast-growing oak tree with vibrant red foliage in autumn, commonly used for shade and landscaping.
variety_info: Quercus rubra is the scientific name.

name: Sugar Maple
description: Famed for its stunning fall foliage and sap, which is used to produce maple syrup.
variety_info: Acer saccharum is the scientific name.

name: Red Maple
description: A medium-sized tree known for its brilliant red fall color and adaptability to a variety of soil conditions.
variety_info: Acer rubrum is the scientific name.

name: Ponderosa Pine
description: A large coniferous tree known for its tall stature and long needles, often used for lumber.
variety_info: Pinus ponderosa is the scientific name.

name: White Pine
description: A tall evergreen tree with long needles and soft, flexible branches.
variety_info: Includes Eastern White Pine and Western White Pine varieties.

name: Lodgepole Pine
description: A tall, slender tree known for its straight trunk and adaptability.
variety_info: Includes Rocky Mountain and Pacific varieties.

name: Sitka Spruce
description: A large, coniferous tree known for its strong, lightweight wood.
variety_info: Various regional varieties exist in its native range.

name: White Spruce
description: A coniferous tree known for its symmetrical shape and soft needles.
variety_info: Includes various local adaptations across North America.

name: Douglas Fir
description: A large evergreen tree known for its distinctive cones and timber quality.
variety_info: Includes Coastal and Rocky Mountain varieties.

name: Balsam Fir
description: A fragrant evergreen tree often used for Christmas trees.
variety_info: Includes various local adaptations.

name: Sycamore
description: A large deciduous tree known for its mottled bark and broad leaves.
variety_info: Includes American Sycamore and London Plane.

name: Birch
description: A slender tree with distinctive white bark and delicate leaves.
variety_info: Includes River Birch and Silver Birch varieties.

name: Aspen
description: A fast-growing tree with white bark and shimmering leaves.
variety_info: Includes Quaking Aspen and Bigtooth Aspen.

name: Cottonwood
description: A large tree with broad leaves and cotton-like seed fluff.
variety_info: Includes Eastern and Black Cottonwood varieties.

name: Redwood
description: Tallest trees in the world, known for their impressive height and longevity.
variety_info: Coast Redwood, Giant Sequoia

name: Sequoia
description: Massive trees known for their size and resistance to fire.
variety_info: Giant Sequoia

name: Cedar
description: Aromatic wood known for its durability and resistance to decay.
variety_info: Eastern Red Cedar, Western Red Cedar

name: Hemlock
description: Shade-loving tree with soft, feathery leaves.
variety_info: Eastern Hemlock, Western Hemlock

name: Hickory
description: Hardwood tree known for its tough wood and edible nuts.
variety_info: Shagbark Hickory, Pignut Hickory

name: Black Walnut
description: Large tree known for its valuable timber and edible nuts.
variety_info: Eastern Black Walnut

name: Cherry Tree
description: Beautiful tree known for its stunning blossoms and sweet fruit.
variety_info: Sweet Cherry, Sour Cherry

name: Apple Tree
description: Popular fruit tree known for its variety of sweet and tart apples.
variety_info: Granny Smith, Fuji, Gala

name: Magnolia
description: Beloved ornamental tree known for its large, fragrant flowers.
variety_info: Southern Magnolia, Star Magnolia

name: Dogwood
description: Beautiful flowering tree known for its showy blooms in spring.
variety_info: Flowering Dogwood, Kousa Dogwood

name: Juniper
description: Junipers are coniferous trees or shrubs with scale-like leaves and berry-like cones.
variety_info: Includes various species like Eastern Red Cedar and Common Juniper.

name: Rhododendron
description: Rhododendrons are known for their stunning flowers and broad leaves, thriving in acidic soils.
variety_info: Includes over 1,000 species and many hybrids.

name: Azalea
description: Azaleas are flowering shrubs known for their vibrant blooms and attractive foliage.
variety_info: Includes deciduous and evergreen varieties.

name: Mountain Laurel
description: Mountain laurel is a native shrub with beautiful clusters of pink or white flowers.
variety_info: Varieties include 'Kalmia latifolia'.

name: Elderberry Shrub
description: Elderberry shrubs are known for their clusters of small white flowers and edible berries.
variety_info: Includes varieties like 'Sambucus nigra'.

name: Blueberry Shrub
description: Blueberry shrubs produce sweet berries that are high in antioxidants.
variety_info: Includes highbush, lowbush, and rabbiteye varieties.

name: Manzanita
description: Manzanitas are evergreen shrubs with beautiful red bark and small pink or white flowers.
variety_info: Includes several species native to Western North America.

name: Sagebrush
description: Sagebrush is a drought-resistant shrub known for its aromatic leaves and resilience in arid conditions.
variety_info: Includes species like Artemisia tridentata.

name: Sumac
description: Sumac produces vibrant autumn foliage and clusters of red berries, often used for flavoring.
variety_info: Includes species like Rhus typhina.

name: Gooseberry Shrub
description: Gooseberry shrubs produce tart berries and are often used in jams and desserts.
variety_info: Includes varieties like Ribes uva-crispa.

name: Snowberry
description: Snowberry is a deciduous shrub known for its white berries and attractive foliage.
variety_info: Common Snowberry (Symphoricarpos albus)

name: Agave
description: Agave is a succulent plant known for its rosette shape and striking foliage.
variety_info: Agave americana

name: Aloe
description: Aloe is a popular succulent known for its medicinal properties and easy care.
variety_info: Aloe vera

name: Prickly Pear Cactus
description: Prickly Pear Cactus features flat pads and edible fruit, known as nopales.
variety_info: Opuntia ficus-indica

name: Saguaro Cactus
description: Saguaro Cactus is an iconic cactus known for its tall, branching arms.
variety_info: Carnegiea gigantea

name: Barrel Cactus
description: Barrel Cactus is a round cactus known for its ribbed skin and vibrant flowers.
variety_info: Ferocactus wislizeni

name: Yucca
description: Yucca is a hardy succulent known for its sword-like leaves and tall flower spikes.
variety_info: Yucca filamentosa

name: Sedum
description: Sedum is a diverse group of succulents, prized for their ease of care and variety.
variety_info: Sedum spectabile

name: Echeveria
description: Echeveria is a popular succulent known for its rosette shape and colorful leaves.
variety_info: Echeveria elegans

name: Century Plant
description: Century Plant is known for its dramatic appearance and long lifespan, flowering once in a lifetime.
variety_info: Agave americana

name: Buffalo Grass
description: A drought-resistant grass native to the Great Plains of North America, ideal for low-maintenance lawns.
variety_info: Varieties include 'Cody' and 'Sharp's Improved'.

name: Blue Grama
description: A warm-season grass known for its blue-green color and attractive seed heads.
variety_info: Common variety is 'Hachita'.

name: Big Bluestem
description: A tall, native grass that is a key component of the North American tallgrass prairie.
variety_info: Notable varieties include 'Kaw' and 'Bonanza'.

name: Little Bluestem
description: A resilient native grass that is often used for erosion control and wildlife habitats.
variety_info: Popular varieties include 'Blaze' and 'The Blues'.

name: Switchgrass
description: A versatile native grass that thrives in a variety of soil types and is often used for bioenergy.
variety_info: Notable varieties include 'Cave-in-Rock' and 'Blackwell'.

name: Wheat
description: A staple cereal grain widely cultivated for food worldwide.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Hard Red Winter' and 'Soft Red Winter'.

name: Barley
description: A cereal grain that is known for its health benefits and use in brewing.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Hulled' and 'Pearl'.

name: Oats
description: A cereal grain commonly used for food and animal feed, known for its health benefits.
variety_info: Popular varieties include 'Avenas' and 'Hulled'.

name: Wild Rye
description: A native grass that is often used for erosion control and habitat restoration.
variety_info: Includes varieties like 'Elymus canadensis' and 'Elymus virginicus'.

name: Morel
description: A highly prized edible mushroom known for its distinctive honeycomb appearance.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Morchella esculenta' and 'Morchella angusticeps'.

name: Chanterelle
description: Chanterelle mushrooms are prized for their delicate flavor and aroma.
variety_info: Commonly found in woodlands.

name: Oyster Mushroom
description: Oyster mushrooms have a mild flavor and are often used in cooking.
variety_info: Available in various colors.

name: Hen-of-the-Woods
description: Hen-of-the-Woods mushrooms, also known as Maitake, are known for their medicinal properties.
variety_info: Grows at the base of trees.

name: Porcini
description: Porcini mushrooms are known for their robust flavor and are often used in Italian cuisine.
variety_info: Commonly found in coniferous forests.

name: Lion's Mane
description: Lion's Mane mushrooms are known for their unique appearance and potential health benefits.
variety_info: Grows on decaying wood.

name: Daylily
description: Daylilies are hardy perennials with vibrant blooms that last for a day.
variety_info: Available in many colors.

name: Hosta
description: Hostas are shade-loving plants known for their attractive foliage.
variety_info: Numerous cultivars available.

name: Peony
description: Peonies are beloved for their large and fragrant blooms.
variety_info: Many cultivars with different flower forms.

name: Coneflower
description: Coneflowers are hardy perennials valued for their daisy-like flowers.
variety_info: Numerous cultivars with vibrant colors.

name: Black-Eyed Susan
description: Black-Eyed Susans are cheerful flowers that attract pollinators.
variety_info: Commonly found in wildflower gardens.

name: Phlox
description: Phlox is a flowering plant known for its vibrant colors and sweet fragrance.
variety_info: Includes tall phlox and creeping phlox varieties.

name: Lavender
description: Lavender is a fragrant herb known for its calming properties and beautiful purple flowers.
variety_info: Includes English lavender and French lavender.

name: Marigold
description: Marigolds are bright, cheerful flowers that are easy to grow and repel pests.
variety_info: Includes African marigold and French marigold.

name: Petunia
description: Petunias are popular bedding plants known for their vibrant colors and long blooming season.
variety_info: Includes wave and grandiflora petunias.

name: Impatiens
description: Impatiens are shade-loving flowers that provide vibrant color in low-light areas.
variety_info: Includes New Guinea and regular impatiens.

name: Zinnia
description: Zinnias are colorful flowers that bloom all summer long and are easy to grow from seed.
variety_info: Includes giant and dwarf zinnia varieties.

name: Snapdragon
description: Snapdragons are unique flowers known for their dragon-shaped blooms and vibrant colors.
variety_info: Includes tall and dwarf snapdragon varieties.
